column4: I've been trying the past hour or two and I can't mount //Laura/Downloads to a local directory in Ubuntu 6.06, any ideas?
anyone here by chance have the fstab to a smbfs?
I used to know how to do this.... :P  mount -t smbfs -o username=<username, password=<password>, '\\box\share\' /mnt/point i think
I did this all the time a few years ago but all the boxes I had set up that way are dead :(
I'm on the live cd, mount -t is supposed to work but it's f0rking up on me, thanks though, I'll see if it does anything ^_^
error?
1 second, yeah error
check your pm
do what now?  got nuffin.  pastebin it?
IRC didn't send it to you?
maybe it thought it was a flood
1 sec
dunno mang.
http://pastebin.ca/79251
ahh.  I don't know if you can specify IP addresses without a specific option in the mount command, by default it's looking for netbios names i believe
thanks for the tip, I just figured it would be more specific, guess not, ty
you see anything else in the syntax by chance?
well the thing that stands out is the IP address in place of the computer name.  you might need an lmhosts file containing a name to IP mapping
can't for the life of me remember where that goes :(
/etc/lmhosts maybe or in your /etc/samba
thanks, I'll try to fix it myself and let you go, but thanks so much for the input dude
